name: docpad-plugin-sitemap
description: DocPad plugin which automatically creates a sitemap.xml file from HTML file output.
readme:
# DocPad Sitemap Plugin This DocPad plugin will automatically generate a valid `sitemap.xml` file for search engines. It's merely a wrapper for the [sitemap.js](https://github.com/ekalinin/sitemap.js) library. This project was forked from the solid start made by [Khalid Jebbari](https://github.com/DjebbZ/docpad-plugin-sitemap). To learn more about sitemap.xml files, read [the protocol](http://www.sitemaps.org/). ## Installation npm install --save docpad-plugin-sitemap ## Dependencies - [bal-util](https://github.com/balupton/bal-util/) - [sitemap.js](https://github.com/ekalinin/sitemap.js) ## Usage For each document, you can specify the following metadata : ``` coffee changfreq: 'always' || 'hourly' || 'daily' || 'weekly' || 'monthly' || 'yearly' || 'never' # Change frequency, defaults to 'weekly' priority: 0.5 # value between 0.0 and 1.0, defaults to 0.5 sitemap: true || false # defaults to true, if false no entry for this document will be generated ``` For the whole site you can set defaults using the plugin configuration in your docpad.cson or docpad.coffee file. ``` coffee plugins: sitemap: cachetime: 600000 changefreq: 'weekly' priority: 0.5 ``` Site URL is read from the `templateData.site.url` property also in that same config file, but will fallback to the `hostname` property in the plugin config if not found. ## License Licensed under the incredibly [permissive](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Permissive_free_software_licence) [MIT License](http://creativecommons.org/licenses/MIT/)
